info.title: Threads API
info.description: The Threads API from Meta allows you to create, manage, and publish Threads content programmatically. This is the official API specification converted from Meta's Postman collection.

post.summary: Exchange the Code For a Token
post.description: Once you receive a code, exchange it for a short-lived access token by sending a `POST` request to the /oauth/access_token [endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/threads/get-started/get-access-tokens-and-permissions#step-2--exchange-the-code-for-a-token)

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your Threads App ID displayed in App Dashboard > App settings > Basic > Threads App ID.

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: Your Threads App Secret displayed in App Dashboard > App settings > Basic > Threads App secret.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The authorization code we passed you in the code parameter when redirecting the user to your redirect_uri.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: This value is required. Set this value to authorization_code.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The redirect URI you passed when you directed the user to the Authorization Window. This must be the same URI or the request will be rejected.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: This value is required. Set this value to client_credentials.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your Threads App ID displayed in App Dashboard > App settings > Basic > Threads App ID.

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: Your Threads App Secret displayed in App Dashboard > App settings > Basic > Threads App secret.

get.description: Use the `GET` /access_token [endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/threads/get-started/long-lived-tokens#get-a-long-lived-token) to exchange a short-lived Threads user access token for a long-lived token.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: This value is required. Set this to th_exchange_token.

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: Your Threads App Secret displayed in App Dashboard > App settings > Basic > Threads App secret.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: Set this to th_refresh_token.

post.description: Use the [reply_control](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/threads/reply-management#control-who-can-reply) parameter to specify who can reply to a post being created for publishing.

get.summary: Get a List of All a User's Threads
get.description: Use the `GET` /{threads-user-id}/threads [endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/threads/threads-media#retrieve-a-list-of-all-a-user-s-threads) to return a paginated list of all threads created by a user.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields for media objects on Threads.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Query string parameter representing the start date for retrieval.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Query string parameter representing the end date for retrieval.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Query string parameter representing the maximum number of media objects or records to return.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Query string parameter representing a cursor that can be used for pagination. Both "before" and "after" cannot be sent in the same request.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Query string parameter representing a cursor that can be used for pagination. Both "before" and "after" cannot be sent in the same request.

parameters.description: Used for categorizing follower demographics. Must be one of the following values: country, city, age, or gender.

parameters.name: search_mode
parameters.description: Specifies the search mode. KEYWORD (default) — The query will be treated as a keyword. TAG — The query will be treated as a topic tag.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Query string parameter representing the start date for retrieval (must be a Unix timestamp or a date/time representation parseable by strtotime();, the timestamp must be greater than or equal to 1688540400 and less than the until parameter).

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Query string parameter representing the end date for retrieval (must be a Unix timestamp or a date/time representation parseable by strtotime();, the timestamp must be less than or equal to the current timestamp and greater than the since parameter).

get.description: Use `POST` /{threads-user-id}/threads_publish [endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/threads/troubleshooting#publishing-does-not-return-a-media-id) to check a container's publishing status.

parameters.name: container_id
parameters.description: The container id

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
EXPIRED — The container was not published within 24 hours and has expired.
ERROR — The container failed to complete the publishing process.
FINISHED — The container and its media object are ready to be published.
IN_PROGRESS — The container is still in the publishing process.
PUBLISHED — The container's media object has been published.

get.description: Use `GET` /threads_publishing_limit [endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/threads/troubleshooting#retrieve-publishing-quota-limit) to check a user's publishing API quota limit.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The user's current Threads API publishing usage total.

parameters.name: input_token
parameters.description: The access token to be inspected.
